summary: This document is an email chain regarding a draft letter to a judge (MN) concerning the admissibility of co-conspirator statements in the Ghislaine Maxwell case. The correspondence involves legal team members preparing the submission due that night.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the legal correspondence; the letter being drafted pertains to her case regarding co-conspirator statements.

events.title: Drafting of Co-Conspirator Statement Letter
events.description: Legal team prepares and exchanges a draft letter to Judge MN seeking to admit certain co-conspirator statements in the Ghislaine Maxwell case, with a submission deadline at midnight.

keyFacts: A draft letter regarding the admissibility of co-conspirator statements in the Ghislaine Maxwell case was being prepared on November 12, 2021.
The letter was intended for submission to a judge referred to as 'MN' by midnight that day.
The correspondence indicates ongoing legal strategy discussions between prosecution and defense teams prior to Maxwell's trial.
